news.title: Twitter starts vacating flexible office spaces in India
news.para: People familiar with the matter said the company has initiated vacating seats in Mumbai under its WeWork arrangement and is serving a three-month notice period. Twitter has also given up its TEC space at One Horizon in Gurgaon and would have vacated seats there.

news.title: SC order could lead builders to bankruptcy, delay registry of 1.5 lakh homes: CREDAI
news.para: "We are of the view that it would take the final figure much higher than the current market rate. In that case we might have to take recourse to NCLT (National Company Law Tribunal)," said Manoj Gaur, President of CREDAI-NCR.

news.title: Noida authority to hold camps to end flats registry deadlock
news.para: Last week, the Noida Authority drew up a list of 75 developers that would be issued notices for defaulting on land payments. Together, these developers owe the Authority Rs 9,000 crore.

news.title: Indiabulls Housing Finance plans to raise Rs 1 billion via public issue
news.para: The company is offering bonds maturing in two years, three years and five years at an annual coupon in the range of 8.90% to 9.30% for institutional investors.

news.title: Adani Group bags Dharavi redevelopment project with a Rs 5,069 crore bid
news.para: ​The group has put in a Rs 5,069 crore bid for the redevelopment of one of the largest slum sprawls in the world, outbidding DLF, which had quoted Rs 2,025 crore, chief executive officer of the project S V R Srinivas said.

news.title: China broadens equity financing channels for developers to aid economy
news.para: The China Securities Regulatory Commission (CSRC) said it would also promote financing by developers through the listing of qualified projects via real estate investment trusts (REITs)，and will encourage the setup of property-focused private equity funds.

news.title: Goa: Sattari illegal sand mining poses threat to Mhadei
news.para: In many areas, rampant extraction of sand on both the banks of the Mhadei has deepened the river bed resulting in its erosion.

news.title: China Evergrande to sell Shenzhen commercial plot for $1.05 billion amid debt woes
news.para: The company said it will sell the land to Shenzhen Anhe No. 1 Property Development, a unit of Shenzhen Anju Construction Investment and Operation. Real-estate firm China Vanke holds a 20% stake in Shenzhen Anju.

news.title: Kolte Patil Developers approves amalgamation with Tuscan Real Estate
news.para: The board also approved demerger of the retail business of its wholly owned subsidiary Kolte-Patil Properties (formerly known as Kolte-Patil Redevelopment) and merge the retail business into the company.

news.title: NCDRC directs JMD to refund excess amount charges from buyers
news.para: Residential Welfare Association of JMD Gardens, a housing society at sector 33, Gurgaon, had filed a complaint on behalf of its 47 members.

news.title: Kotak Special Situations Fund invests Rs 550 crore in Sanghi Industries Group
news.para: Of the total, KSSF has invested Rs 500 crore in the NCD's of Sanghi Industries (SIL) and Rs 50 crore in the NCD's of a company owned by the promoters of SIL, which in turn will be infused in SIL.

news.title: Chandigarh administration mulls land use conversion policy for industrial area
news.para: The groundwork for the policy has started, which if implemented, would allow conversion of land use from industrial to commercial.

news.title: Uttar Pradesh to soon hire urban planners for development push
news.para: The three government departments and agencies under them for development and planning have only 67 planners at present against the requirement of 1,500 urban planners.

news.title: Gurugram: Rs 122 crore paid as penalties, MCG faces acute funds crunch now
news.para: The civic body has only collected Rs 150 crore as property tax and generated a revenue of Rs 15 crore, against the target of Rs 100 crore for the current fiscal, from advertisements to date.

news.title: Panchkula civic body's committee discusses recovery of 132 crore dues
news.para: During the meeting, Panchkula mayor Kulbhushan Goyal directed officials to recover the share of stamp duty, mining and land acquisition from Haryana Urban Development Authority (HUDA) and the mining department.
